alert.note: Alert for Boone; Lincoln; Logan; Wayne (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 1:47PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Lincoln, northwestern Logan, east central Wayne and northwestern Boone Counties through 230 PM EDT... At 147 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Harts, or 14 miles northwest of Logan, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Chapmanville, Ranger, Gill, Spurlockville, Harts, Julian, Alum Creek, Danville, Turtle Creek, Sod, Woodville, Palermo, Foster, Griffithsville, Alkol, Mud, and Yawkey. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 34 and 62, and between mile markers 64 and 65. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
